About This Exercise

Title: Validate Zeppelin Interpreters
Objective: Validate the Shell interpreter and the JDBC interrpreter for HDFS
File locations: No data
Successful outcome: Both interpreters are running
Before you begin: N/A

Check the Bindings for Interpreters

paragraphs.title: 1 - View the list of available interpreters
paragraphs.text:
%md

Click on Interpreter binding (Gear icon upper right corner).
This opens a list of interpreters. You can select the interpreters to bound to a notebook.
You can restart an interpreter by clicking Restart. 
Click Cancel.

paragraphs.title: 3 - Run klist and sudo command as user zepplein, this will fail

msg.data:
klist: No credentials cache found (filename: krb5cc_cldr)

We trust you have received the usual lecture from the local System
Administrator. It usually boils down to these three things:

    #1) Respect the privacy of others.
    #2) Think before you type.
    #3) With great power comes great responsibility.

sudo: no tty present and no askpass program specified
ExitValue: 1

paragraphs.text:
%md

The user zeppelin does not have a TGT nor does it have sudo access. It only provides access to a local shell.

msg.data: The user zeppelin does not have a TGT nor does it have sudo access. It only provides access to a local shell.

paragraphs.title: 4 - Use su to switch user to run klist to verify the TGT

msg.data:
Password: Ticket cache: FILE:/tmp/krb5cc_213600001_HnUsoh
Default principal: allan_admin@EXAMPLE.COM

Valid starting       Expires              Service principal
05/11/2022 08:16:08  05/12/2022 08:16:08  krbtgt/EXAMPLE.COM@EXAMPLE.COM
	renew until 05/18/2022 08:16:08

paragraphs.text:
%md

The switch user command will change user to a managed user. You must pipe in the passwod. The su - syntax sets the environment for the user. A Kerberos TGT is required to acccess CDP services.

msg.data: The switch user command will change user to a managed user. You must pipe in the passwod. The su - syntax sets the environment for the user. A Kerberos TGT is required to acccess CDP services.

paragraphs.title: 5 - Use the kinit to create a TGT
paragraphs.text:
%sh

# Run the kinit command
echo BadPass@1 | su - allan_admin -c 'kdestroy'
echo "Run kinit"
echo BadPass@1 | su - allan_admin -c 'echo BadPass@1 | kinit allan_admin'
echo BadPass@1 | su - allan_admin -c 'klist'

paragraphs.text:
%md

Every paragraph initiates its own shell. You may have to run multiple commands in a single paragraph. You can use # to add comments.

paragraphs.title: 8 - Verify the admin user, allan_admin, has superuser privileges
paragraphs.text:
%sh

echo BadPass@1 | su - allan_admin -c "hdfs dfs -mkdir /allan_test"
echo BadPass@1 | su - allan_admin -c "hdfs dfs -ls /"

Validate Livy for Spark

paragraphs.title: 17 - Run pyspark to calculate PI
paragraphs.text:
%livy.pyspark

def insid(p):
    x, y = random.random(), random.random()
    return x*x + y*y > 1
    
count = sc.parallelize(range(0, NUM_SAMPLES)) \
    .filter(inside.count()
print("Pi is roughly $f" % (4.0 * count / NUM_SAMPLES))
